metadata.title: CVE-2021-27922 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Pillow before 8.1.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) because the reported size of a contained image is not properlychecked for an ICNS container, and thus an attempted memory allocation canbe very large.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.3
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.3').
pillow-python2 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
